div.bibl: Bulletin Italian Chamber of Commerce, October 1922. IN HONOR OF THE ITALIAN CONSUL.

body.p: The Justinian Society of Advocates, an organization composed of Chicago lawyers of Italian birth or extraction, gave a lunch for the new Italian Consul for Chicago, Commendatore Zurini, on October 17, at the La Salle Hotel.

Attorney De Grazia was toastmaster and introduced the following speakers: De Stefano, Crapple, Cuttone, Allegretti, and Borrelli. Commendatore Zurini thanked the gathering in a short speech for the honor proffered him.
